intro: Disciphania ernstii var. clausa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved disciphania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in humid forests. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
